== Main Inclusion Report for kopete-facebook ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/k/kopete-facebook]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architecture
# ''Rationale:''
** Social From the Start
0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=kopete|CVE entries]]</nowiki>: None  related
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=kopete|Secunia history]]</nowiki>: None
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid.  No daemons
** Network activity: does open port.  Processes incoming data
** Does directly (not through a library) process structured (PDF, etc) data
** No known source code review performed
0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Always works out the box
** No debconf questions
** Not in Debian
** <nowiki>[[http://duncan.mac-vicar.com/blog/archives/545|Upstream]]</nowiki> is frenetic
** No upstream bug tracker
** Hardware: n/a
** No test suite
0. ''UI standards:''
** User-visible strings are internationalized using gettext
** Package with translatable strings does build a PO template but isn't currently used, patch sent upstream
0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliant
** Packaging system cdbs  Patch system: quilt
0. ''Dependencies:''
** Qt, QJSON
** QJSON see MainInclusionReportQjson
0. ''Maintenance:''
** Updates will be needed during Karmic
** Kubuntu packagers will monitor the quality
0. ''Background information:''
** The general purpose and context of the package is clear from the package's debian/control file.
** Upstream call it Kopete Facebook
